synthesis_conditions.chemicals_used: Cd3(TPPA)2(NDA)3]·(DMF)10·(H2O)6, TPPA: tri(4-(pyridine-4-yl)phenyl)amine, NDA: 2,6-naphthalenedicarboxylic acid, DMF: N,N-dimethylformamide
synthesis_conditions.temperature: 100 to 293 K for thermal expansion observations
synthesis_conditions.pressure: 1 atm to 11.12 GPa for pressure-induced luminescence changes
synthesis_conditions.amount_of_solvents: DMF:10, H2O:6 (molar ratio in the final compound)
synthesis_conditions.equipment: Diamond anvil cell (DAC) for high-pressure experiments
synthesis_conditions.additional_information: The synthesis involves a gradual and reversible structural deformation under either thermal or pressure stimulation. The TPPA molecules, coordinately bound to the channel in a face-to-face arrangement, alter their conformation and arrangement in response to these stimuli.

synthesis_conditions.description: The solvent-exchange method was applied to treat the sample, successfully exchanging a considerable amount of original solvent molecules with some other common solvents.
synthesis_conditions.results: Although these solvent-exchanged crystals exhibited a slight change in the fluorescence signal, their stimuli-responsive luminescent character fully remained and was not strongly dependent on the nature of the solvent, including linear dependence on stimuli and reversibility.
